Date of Travel: MAY 2018
Airline: Aegean Airlines
Livery: Aegean Standard
Route: ATH-BEG
Aircraft: Airbus A320
Registration: SX-DVH
Flight Number: A3 976
Miles: 510
Airborne time: 1h17m
Notes: None
Cost to book: ¬£66 one way

Thanks for finding my video and pressing play!

Following on from my last video featuring Aegean Airlines‚Äô business class, today let‚Äôs look at their economy product. I travelled up to Belgrade, Serbia with them and was on a basic economy fare. 

Overall, Aegean offers great value across both cabins. This trip was not at all expensive and came with a free breakfast roll, juice and coffee even on this short 500-mike sector. While the food is never going to be great quality in economy, it‚Äôs more than most legacy airlines in Europe offer and certainly places Aegean towards the top end of the value scale. 

There are even boiled sweets handed out in economy! Last time I remember that was travelling with Air 2000 back in the late 1990s...remember them??

Next up, Air Serbia ATR 72 between Belgrade and Zagreb, featuring a rather nasty thunderstorm where we were lucky to avoid being hot by lightning! 

If you want to find out more about my future plans and join in conversations I have about travel, follow me on Twitter: @pauls_trips. I‚Äôve started using it properly now and it would be great to see some of you there too.
